page.title: 11THE HEMLOCK STONE
page.content: The Hemlock Stone is a unique piece of rock which has probably remained in its present position since The Ice Age.It is approximately 10 metres high and 22 metres in girth.It stands on Coventry Lane between the boundaries of Stapleford and Bramcote, in one of the most beautiful spots in the country. Protected by sand and being covered with barium sulphate, it has withstood the action of erosion and weathering down the ages. It is a real landmark, which thousands of people have visited over the years, as there is nothing to equal it in the whole of the country. There is a legend that tells of a church on the hill where the stone now stands. The devil did not like it, so he picked up the Hemlock Stone and threw it at the church, but he missed it and he was not pleased.
